title: Family identifies 5-year-old boy fatally shot in Madisonville
content:
CINCINNATI —
A 5-year-old boy was fatally shot in Madisonville Saturday, police said.
Cincinnati Police Lt. Steve Saunders said that the shooting happened on the 6200 block of Chandler Street just after noon.
The family identified the child as Sincere Peek.
Police said Peek and his 11-year-old brother were playing upstairs when the gun went off. The mother was downstairs at the time.
First responders found Peek with a gunshot wound to the head, police said. He was taken to Children's Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.
Authorities have not determined whether the gunshot was self-inflicted. The circumstances remain under investigation by both personal crimes and homicide units.
